refnamediv.refpurpose: Send a NULL-terminated string to PostgreSQL backend

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: pg_put_line sends a NULL-terminated string to the PostgreSQL backend server. This is useful for example for very high-speed inserting of data into a table, initiated by starting a PostgreSQL copy-operation. That final NULL-character is added automatically. &return.success;

note.para: The application must explicitly send the two characters "\." on the last line to indicate to the backend that it has finished sending its data.
